Package stars

Class PasswordModule

java.lang.Object
stars.PasswordModule
public class PasswordModule
extends java.lang.Object
Class for generating hashes from plaintext passwords and verifying them. This class DOES NOT store or retrieve passwords. Each password is generated using a specific hashing algorithms and variables defined within this class. When a user creates a password for the first time, they will enter a plaintext password to be registered. For security, the plaintext password should be hashed, and the hash is stored instead.
Since:
23/10/2020
Version:
1.0
Author:
Lai Ming Hui

  • Method Details

    • generateSalt

      private static byte[] generateSalt​(int length)
      Generates salt for stronger hashing.
      Parameters:
      length - : Length of the returned byte array.
      Returns:
      A randomly generated byte array

    • hashWithSalt

      private static java.lang.String hashWithSalt​(java.lang.String pwd, byte[] salt)
      Create a hash from a plaintext string pwd and a salt. This function only returns the hash of pwd. This hash should not be stored on its own in a password database. See generatePasswordHash() to generate a complete hash for a plaintext password.
      Parameters:
      pwd - plain text string to be hashed
      salt - the Salt used to create the hash
      Returns:
      A randomly generated byte array

    • verifyPassword

      public static boolean verifyPassword​(java.lang.String pwd, java.lang.String storedString)
      Verifies an input password with a hashed password stored in database.
      Parameters:
      pwd - : Input password from console input
      storedString - : A string created from hashing a registered password.
      Returns:
      True if the hash of pwd and storedString is the same.

    • generatePasswordHash

      public static java.lang.String generatePasswordHash​(java.lang.String pwd)
      Generates a random string by hashing String pwd. This function should be used when creating hashes of new passwords. (Passwords that has yet to be stored in database.) This function generates a salt and a hashed string and combines them into a string that should be stored in a database and used for authentication.
      Parameters:
      pwd - : Plain text input from user
      Returns:
      A randomly generated string to be stored for future authentication.
